title: permissions: `recieve issue` buttons should be hidden in other libraries' holdings

labels.name: effort: minor
labels.description: Solved quickly

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
### Bug description:
In the holdings detailed view, the buttons for recieving the next issue are always active even if the holdings doesn't belong to my current library. 
If I have `all_permissions`, the backend lets me recieve the issues, but this can create problems with temporary locations. If I don't have permissions for this library, I get a 403 error message when trying to quick-recieve and a "forbidden" message when manually recieving. 

### Expected behavior:
Same as "edit item", these two buttons are only displayed when I am viewing a holding linked to my current active library. Otherwise, they should be hidden. 

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/holdings/detail/2618
2. Connected as Virgile or Astrid (with active library not AVISE)
3. See that you have buttons for recieve and quick-recieve, when you should not because it is not your library.

**Version:**
<!-- In which version of RERO ILS did this problem happen? -->

`v1.15.0`

title: Some loan stay with `CREATED` temporary state.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
### Bug description:
In some special cases, some loan are saved with `CREATED` state. This state should only be a temporary state when a `Loan` object is create, but must only transit to `PENDING` or `ITEM_ON_LOAN`. This should never happens


### Expected behavior:
No `CREATED` loan should be saved avec any circulation operation.

### Steps to Reproduce:
don't really how to reproduce.

### Context


**Version:**
`v1.13.0`

### Anything else?
No circulation operations are directly linked with `Loan` REST_API, all API calls are linked to `Item` API (see `items.views.api_views.py)`.
In some cases, the `add_action_parameters_and_flush_indexes` decorator create a new loan object (https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/staging/rero_ils/modules/items/decorators.py#L61 , https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/staging/rero_ils/modules/items/api/circulation.py#L159). But, if no operation are done on this loan due to `invenio_circulation` triggers, then this loan stay on `CREATED` state and should be removed.

I will be interesting to create a system to check if the loan state changed after some circulation operation (request, checkin,checkout, ... not extend [status stay `ITEM_ON_LOAN`]). If it's the case, an error will be logged in Sentry with request context (loan, patron, itty, ...) for future analyzes.

After any circulation operation, if a new loan status is `CREATED` an exception should be raised and this loan should be deleted.
_The best solution should be to not commit/reindex a loan during the circulation process but commit all changes at the end of action process (or rollback if any errors are detected) but this behavior change will be more challenging._

title: At desk notification gets cancelled if `loan` is not indexed fast enough

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
### Bug description:
Sometimes, the `at_desk` notification gets cancelled when it should be sent: item exists, loan exists, loan is `AT_DESK`. 

**Hypothesis:** The notification processing takes places 1 second after the transaction. Depending on the server load at any given moment, the loan indexing may not be over when the notification is processed. The notification sees the old loan status and cancel the sending.

### Expected behavior:
All `at_desk` notifications should be sent if configured as such.

### Steps to Reproduce:
Difficult to reproduce as it might depend on the server load. It happens regularly in production.

#### Example
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50177009/178672963-5f8ec0dc-671a-4c70-b3ce-afe116739ba3.png)
The `availability` notification is correctly sent 5 minutes later.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50177009/178673104-3208b368-23d8-4826-91e7-0ba9a935335e.png)
The loan is `ITEM_AT_DESK` but it was processed less than 1 second before the notification.

### Context
<!-- In which environment did the problem occur? -->

**Server:**
* production: [bib.rero.ch](https://bib.rero.ch)

**Version:**
<!-- In which version of RERO ILS did this problem happen? -->

`v1.11.0`

### Anything else?
<!-- Any other useful information about the problem -->

To ensure that the notification gets the correct loan state, we might force it to wait the loan's reindexing or delay the notification processing by 30 secs-1min. 

It would also be nice to have a more robust notification log, that allows us to see which check did not pass so that a notification was not sent.

title: Some fees calculate the payment form sum incorrectly

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

labels.name: client request
labels.description: Issue reported by production libraries

labels.name: dev: sentry
labels.description: For PRs that are created to correct an error raised by Sentry.

body:
### Bug description:
When a patron has fees that are above a certain sum (it seems...), the form to pay the fees in the professional view auto-populates with a fraction (example : 7.20000000001, see screenshot). This can also create an error in the backend `PatronTransactionEvent data`, see Sentry : RERO-ILS-2TZ, etc.

### Expected behavior:

- The form should automatically contain the correct amount and not add or subtract fractions. 
- The backend should not accept invalid data, only fractions of `0.05`.

### Steps to Reproduce:
Steps to reproduce the problem (exact sum criteria to reproduce are unknown):
1. Find a patron with fees multiple of 0.20 and above 5
2. Click on "Pay all"
3. See that the sum in the form is incorrect

Maybe just needs a more complete implementation of this fix: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/pull/2829

### Context
<!-- In which environment did the problem occur? -->

**Server:**
* production: [bib.rero.ch](https://bib.rero.ch)

**Version:**
<!-- In which version of RERO ILS did this problem happen? -->

`v1.11.0`

title: renewals: always uses the checkout library

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
The circulation action extend, uses the checkout library to
find the right policy, it does not take into consideration
the transaction library to calculate the new end_date and
the field due_soon_date.

* Fixes #2872
 
Co-Authored-by: Aly Badr <aly.badr@rero.ch>

## How to test?

- Login to the admin interface and checkout and item to a patron in the owning library
- Switch to any other library in the same organisation
- Renew the same item for the patron 
- Make sure the new `end_date` will be calculated always according to the owning library `checkout_library` instead of the `transaction_library`
- Another test is to make sure the `renew` button is always available and based on the `cipo` of the checkout_location. Changing the transaction_library, does not affect the display of the renew button.

body:
### Bug description:
In the professional view or in public view, an item with URL starting with rtsp protocole (rtsp://) 
is flagged as "unsafe" when the view is generated by the angular component. So, the link doesn't work !

### Expected behavior:
An URL starting with rtsp protocole should work correctly when the user click on it.

### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to ilsdev and login as Astrid. Go to the professional view
2. Take an existing document and create a new item, with an URL starting with rtsp:// . Save it.
3. Check the link displayed and try to click on it. It doesn't work. 
4. At the bottom of the screen, you see "unsafe:rtsp://...."

### Context
Linked to Issue https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/2892

**Server:**
- dev: [ilsdev.test.rero.ch](https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch)

**Version:**

title: Incorrect patron communication_channel after removing email.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
### Bug description:
When a patron removes the email from his/her own profile via the public interface, the `communication_channel` remains set to `email` even though the patron has no `additional_communication_email` set.

### Expected behavior:
The patron field `communication_channel` should be set to `mail` if it has no email configured for both fields `email` and `additional_communication_email`

### Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a user profile in the public interface
2. Remove the contents of the field `email`
3. Save the profile
5. Go to the professional interface and check there is no emails set in the field `additional_communication_email`
6. The patron `communication_channel` is still set to `email`.

title: Renew button sometimes appears for items that are not renewable

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: dev: sentry
labels.description: For PRs that are created to correct an error raised by Sentry.

body:
### Bug description:
Impossible to renew an item from the admin and public interfaces. The following error is captured by Sentry in these cases:
```
unsupported type for timedelta days component: NoneType
```

The anaylsis of the problem shows that there are two logic implemented to:
1. display the `renew` button: this logic does not take into account the `transaction_library` instead it calculates if item can be renewed or not according to the `checkout_library`. 
2. place the `renew` transaction: this logic does take into account the `transaction_library` and decides if a renew can be made at the `transaction_library`



### Expected behavior:
A renewal is possible whenever the button `renew` is enabled and it is calculated always based on the `checkout_library`

### Steps to Reproduce:
For some checked-out items
1. Go to the admin interface and then to the checkin menu for a given patron
4. Click on the button `renew` if it is enabled for a transaction
5. You receive a generic error 

### Context
bib.test.rero.ch
bib.rero.ch

title: Multiple loans for the same item and patron

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Stale or no longer relevant

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

labels.name: dev: sentry
labels.description: For PRs that are created to correct an error raised by Sentry.

body:
This error message appears, not very often, in Sentry. 
`400 MultipleLoansOnItemError: Multiple active loans on item with PID 'item:________'`

Hypothesis 1
* RERO ILS sometimes is not able to re-index the item according to the realised circulation transaction.
    * 2 Consequences:
      * The librarian see a bug (the item does not go in transit, a flash message is not displayed, etc.)  
      * This might enable to create another loan for the same patron/item

Hypothesis 2
* RERO ILS creates two identical loans when some checkouts are made. The two loans are created in the same second. Later on, when the patron returns the item, REROILS attempts to checkin the first loan successfully and reports that a second ACTIVE loan is found on the system. 
      * For the librarian, the quick fix is to check-in the item another time, or manually delete the extra loan.
      * Ideally, the front-end needs to block the check-out input form to prevent a second checkout. The input form is disabled while loading the transaction and until receiving the response.

### Expected behavior:
One loan is created for each checkout. The item is always reindexed after the corresponding circulation transaction.

### Steps to Reproduce

* Open a patron account with at least 120 loans
* Before the front-end has loaded all the 120 loans, already enter an item barcode (to be checked out)
* Try to enter this item barcode various times as quick as possible
* By chance, you will be able to reproduce the case

### See also

https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/1864

### Server

* [X] production: [bib.rero.ch](https://bib.rero.ch) 

### Version
`v1.9.0`, `v1.12.0`, `v1.13.0`

### Examples


**Example 1**
This example is based on patron.pid:36102 and item.pid:2916843 on bib.rero.ch.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/190449816-bfbe18d8-1262-4754-97a7-c23c396b35a5.png)

**Example 2**
Observed on `v1.13.0` on 27.09.2022
Based on item_pid:3237989 AND patron_pid:29951 on bib.rero.ch.
Scenario explained by the librarian:
1. The item belongs to La Chaux-de-Fonds, was requested for pickup in Neuchâtel (loan A)
2. La Chaux-de-Fonds did a checkin in order to validate the request (loan A)
   * result: the item didn't go "in transit" (analysis: probably the item was not updated/reindexed)
3. La Chaux-de-Fonds deleted the first request and created another one
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/192743016-c5fc06d6-4234-4228-9819-9379dde4dd8d.png)

title: Only one mainTitle is indexed in a partOf document field.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

labels.name: client request
labels.description: Issue reported by production libraries

body:
<!-- Please, fill the report as precisely as possible.
Be clear and concise. Write a full sentence in the issue title.
Thanks for your help! -->

### Bug description:
<!-- A concise description of the bug you are experiencing -->

When the `partOf` document contains several titles only the last one is indexed in the child document. See for example:
```
Le ski et ses frontières
Auteur: Busset, Thomas
Document hôte (partOf): Surmonter les frontières à ski
PID: 2079395
```

### Expected behavior:
<!-- A concise description of what you expected to happen -->
The full title: `title._text` is indexed in the child document.

### Steps to Reproduce:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Create a document with `partOf` field on a document containing multiple fields for title.
2. Check the search results: https://myserver.xx/api/documents/?q=pid:new_pid
3. The new document should contains the full parent title.

PRE: 
1. Search for ["surmonter busset ski"](https://bib.rero.ch/professional/records/documents?q=surmonter%20busset%20ski&page=1&size=10&sort=bestmatch&simple=1) : only one result
2. Search ["überwinden busset ski"](https://bib.rero.ch/professional/records/documents?q=uberwinden%20busset%20ski&page=1&size=10&sort=bestmatch&simple=1) : three results
3. Only the german part of the child document's title is indexed and gives the expected search results

### Context
<!-- In which environment did the problem occur? -->

**Server:**
* [x] production: [bib.rero.ch](https://bib.rero.ch) or [ils.bib.uclouvain.be](https://ils.bib.uclouvain.be)
* [x] test: [bib.test.rero.ch](https://bib.test.rero.ch)
* [x] dev: [ilsdev.test.rero.ch](https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch)
* [x] dev test : [ils.test.rero.ch](https://ils.test.rero.ch)

**Version:**
<!-- In which version of RERO ILS did this problem happen? -->

`<=v1.9.0`

title: Some requests are not cancelled when they expire

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: effort: 2pt
labels.description: 2 point of effort estimated for the implementation

labels.name: client request
labels.description: Issue reported by production libraries

body:
**Describe the bug**

Context:
The request expiration feature has a daily job that *convert or cancel or act* on the loans when they expire. In human language, when a request not picked up reaches its expiration date, it is cancelled.

Problem:
* In some cases, the loans are not impacted correctly: see section *To Reproduce*.
* The request cancellation (in case of an expiration) is not captured in the operation logs.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a request with a pick-up location different from the item location
2. Validate this request/loan
3. Receive this loan from the pick-up location > it should be "at desk"
4. Wait the expiration of the request (so: no checkout is done)
5. See that the loan goes "in_transit_for_pickup" instead of going "in_transit_to_house"

**Expected behavior**

When a request expires, the system:
* cancels the request in the sense of the action `CANCEL_REQUEST_2` [described here](https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/master/doc/circulation/actions.md)
    * a different loan state can appear depending on the context (pending loan, item location vs. pick-up location, etc.)
* record an operation log for this (trigger: cancel) which is shown in the item circulation history

*TO BE SOLVED WITH https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/2707*

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.8.0`

labels.name: bug

labels.description: Everything around logging user or system activities

labels.name: effort: 1pt
labels.description: 1 point of effort estimated for the implementation

body:
**Describe the bug**

The daily task `rero_ils.modules.items.tasks.clean_obsolete_temporary_item_types` doesn't seem to work as intended. It runs without errors but temporary location in items remains after its due date.

**To Reproduce**

1. Set a temporary location for an item with a deletion date
2. After the deletion date is passed, the item still has its temporary location

**Expected behavior**

Temporary locations with overdue deletion dates should be deleted daily by the system.

title: Calculation of fees based on the library of the renewal or checkin, instead of the library of the checkout

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

In most of the cases, fees are calculated correctly. In some cases though, they are counted on closed days.

Hypothesis to verify: maybe the fees takes as basis the checkin library opening hours and exception days.

**To Reproduce**

Unknown, see hypothesis above

**Expected behavior**

Calculation of overdue incremental fees always takes as basis the checkout library opening hours and exception days.

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.8.0`

**Example 1**

* Loan pid:269879
* Applied cipo is pid:22
* Item library pid:30 (La Chaux-de-Fonds)
* Checkout library pid:30 (La Chaux-de-Fonds)
* After last renewal, loan due date was 23.12.21
* La Chaux-de-Fonds was closed on 24-26.12
* Grace period (4 days) was applied on 27-30.12
* La Chaux-de-Fonds was closed on 31.12-03.01
* Fees started on 03.01 instead of 04.01

Other examples of this error exist in the same user account (fees of CHF 4.-). All are item of La Chaux-de-Fonds checked out in La Chaux-de-Fonds, but checked in in Neuchâtel. Maybe the fees takes as basis the checkin library opening hours and exception days. Indeed, Neuchatel was open on 03.01.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/152845923-e4e60b62-ec0c-4a6e-8ba4-53464f9b7469.png)

body:
<!--
    Please, fill the bug report as precisely as possible.
    Write a full sentence in the issue title.

-->

**Describe the bug**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
For now, the pickup deadline is calculated starting from the request date.
Ex : https://ils.bib.uclouvain.be/professional/records/items/detail/3259079
https://ils.bib.uclouvain.be/professional/records/items/detail/3511120
https://ils.bib.uclouvain.be/professional/records/items/detail/3499505

It appears that when a request is validated with 'validate_first_pending' the request transaction_date isn't updated. It's important to do that because the loan request_expiration_date is calculated on this date.

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Place a request on a borrowed item. (or find a borrowed item with a request on it).
2. Wait one day and checkin the item.
3. See the pickup deadline.

**Expected behavior**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The pickup deadline should be calculated from the checkin date.

**Context**

title: Incremental overdue fees should always be calculated according to the checkout library's opening days

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: effort: 1pt
labels.description: 1 point of effort estimated for the implementation

body:
**Describe the bug**

Currently, the incremental overdue fees are calculated according to the opening days. If a loan is renewed, the fees will base on the opening days of the transaction library of the renewal.

In case of a trilogy checked out in library A where
- 2 items are renewed online by the patron (operator is: system)
    - fees are calculated based on library A
- 1 item is renewed by a librarian in library B
    - fees are calculated based on library B

By default, the "transaction library" of a renewal made by the patron (online) is the item library.

**To Reproduce**

See above

**Expected behavior**

Fees always base on the opening days of the checkout library.

* the fees always take as base the opening days of checkout library, not of the renewal library
* (nice to have) the "transaction library" of a renewal made by the patron (online) is the checkout library - and not the item owning library.

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.7.0`

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the v1.8 RC installed on ilsdev, a librarian who uses the inventory list can see all items, from all organisations.
Previously, the system used a least a filter on the organization of the librarian.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to ilsdev and login as Jean (librarian of Aoste)
2. Go to professional view and click on Inventory list
3. By default, the system filters on my library (OK) but when I unselect it, the facet "libraries" displays all libraries, from all organizations. 

**Expected behavior**

body:
<!-- Please, fill the report as precisely as possible.

### How it works
<!-- A clear and concise description of how the existing feature currently works. Please mention if it involves the public or professional view, and in which section.-->
Sentry raises an internal server error if someone tries to load a record with `_draft:true` in the public UI because the document doesn't return a `type`. See Sentry error ID `RERO-ILS-163`.

Following draft record has no `type`: https://bib.rero.ch/global/documents/2090554

### Improvement suggestion
<!-- Explain what is missing, why it is frustrating
and how this could be improved. -->
It is very unlikely that someone tries to load a draft record in the public UI. This error is thus of very low priority.

title: circulation: problem to manage checkin operations when item/patron barcode are identical

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
Today, the professional interface of RERO-ILS offers a single box to manage checkout/checkin operations.
In the backend, using the barcode, the system tries to find a patron (to do a checkout), otherwise
it tries to find an item (to do a checkin).

Some insitutions have same barcode (values) used for item barcode and patron barcode.
In this case, this single box can't be used to do checkin, because it always find the patron (not the item)

**To Reproduce**

- Creates a patron A with a barcode 123456
- Creates a patron B with a barcode 456789
- Creates an item with barcode 123456
- Checkout item 123456 on patron account B
- Checkin the item 123456, you'll see the system find patron A -> you can't checkin the item by this way !

**Expected behavior**

In the checkout/checkin screen, please add a checkbox "Checkin Only" to indicate to RERO-ILS you specify an item barcode and you want to checkin it. It will clearly separate the behaviour of circulation operations.

If possible: adds a new keyboard shortcut for "checkin" in order to quickly lands to the page with the box "Checkin Only" checked

**Context**

* server: ils.test.rero.ch
* version: `v1.6.1`

title: Correct the handling of alternate graphics in Title proper fields (display and indexing)

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: f: public ui
labels.description: Public interface, as opposed to the professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
<!--
    Please, fill the bug report as precisely as possible.
    Write a full sentence in the issue title.
    Thanks a lot for helping us!
-->

**Describe the bug**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
When a document has an alternate graphics (ex. Title in cyrillic characters), the field "value" is doubled to add the transliteration. The sub-element "language" is used to determine the language and graphic.

There are problems in two cases :

1. The sub-element "Language" is used only in 1 of the proper title's value (most of the migrated records are in this case).
- The display of the titles is good.
- The proper title's value missing the Language element **is not indexed**. Therefore, a search on this title is not successful.

2. The sub-element "Language" is used in the 2 proper title's values.
- The **display of the titles is wrong**.  In the detailed view of the document, the title appears 3 times (see screenshot below).
- Both of the proper title's values are indexed.

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->
Case 1
1. Search fot thoses terms "Frantsuzsko-russkii slovar".
2. See that the search is not successful even though the following record exists : https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/detail/252

Case 2
1. Display the detail view of a document in cyrillic, with the value language used both for the original graphic and the transliteration (ex. : https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/detail/712)
4. See that there is 3 entries for the Title

**Expected behavior**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
For a Title, if the value is repeated for transliteration (same language, different graphic) : the Title should display : 
- First : the original graphic (ex. for russian : in cyrillic).
- Below : the transliteration.

All values are indexed, regardless of the presence of the Language sub-element.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->

* server: [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]
* version: `v1.10.0` or the commit hash (see frontpage).

[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

**Screenshots**

<!--
    If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
-->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55576980/145401360-2b612629-c915-4afe-bddd-1ce6d86fcfc6.png)
Expected display : 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55576980/145405392-8dae249e-c48a-4632-a1cf-304ec35f7764.png)

**Additional context**

<!--
    Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
On the 07/12/2021, the display of the Title was different : 1 entry for the original graphic, 2 entries for the transliteration.
On the 09/12/2021 : 2 entries for the original graphic, 1 entry for the transliteration in the wrong order (the original graphic should be first).

title: The first document title should be of type `bf:Title`

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Improvement of an existing feature

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: f: activity-logs
labels.description: Everything around logging user or system activities

body:
**Describe the bug**

If the parallel appear before the proper title in the array of field `title`, this generates a bug:
* error message in the circulation interface when trying to check out/in an item linked to this document

This problem is due to the operation logs, that are not able to retrieve the field `title._text`

Example of document causing the problem:
```json
"title": [
      {
        "mainTitle": [
          {
            "value": "Le voyage imaginaire"
          }
        ],
        "type": "bf:ParallelTitle"
      },
      {
        "_text": "Cirque du Soleil = Le voyage imaginaire",
        "mainTitle": [
          {
            "value": "Cirque du Soleil"
          }
        ],
        "type": "bf:Title"
      }
    ]
```

**To Reproduce**

See example above.

**Expected behavior**

The correction must be made on 2 levels

1. **JSON schema**: It is not possible to save a document with a first title of a type other than `bf:Title`
2. **Operation logs**: they should be able to retrieve `title._text` in any position of the array (see code below)

    ```py
    @classmethod
    def _get_document_data(cls, document_pid):
        """Get document record data.

        :param str document_pid: Document PID
        :returns: Document formatted data
        :rtype: dict
        """
        document = Document.get_record_by_pid(document_pid)
        document = document.dumps()
        return {
            'pid': document['pid'],
            'title':
            document['title'][0]['_text'],
            'type':
            document['type'][0].get('subtype',
                                    document['type'][0]['main_type'])
        }
    ```

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.6.1`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

body:
**Describe the bug**

Dates are *sometimes* displayed with a delay of 1 day in the tab "Fees" of the patron account (professional interface)

Date problem (see screenshot, case A):
* No fees on Monday as if it was Sunday 
* Fees calculated until one day after checkin
* There might be a day or date shift
* A lot of these examples are referenced in [this file](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rcZy1NGBhwZ-3sagP3Dt-uZKaAhpMjX6JERa-2vUir0/edit#gid=1702820063) (all for RBNJ org)

Date problem (see screenshot, case B)
* Due date is not displayed correctly on patron account (tab "On loan" and "Fees")
    * In the loan JSON data, the endDate is one day before
* This is maybe also the case on patron public account

Related issue: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/2198
* was deployed on bib.rero.ch on 06.10.21
* the examples were observed after (on 26.10.21)

**To Reproduce**

Unknown, see screenshots.

**Expected behavior**

Dates are calculated/displayed correctly.

**Context**

* version: `v1.6.1`

title: Impossible to save a document with field `seriesStatement`

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug (critical)
labels.description: Blocking issue, should be fixed ASAP

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

It is impossible to save a document with field `seriesStatement`. Cause: the sub-field `identifiedBy` has a default value set on "bf:Isbn". When saving the document, the validator expect a value for this identifier.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a new document
2. Fill all required fields
3. Add field "Series statement" and set a value
4. Try to save and see error

**Expected behavior**

It is possible to save even if no identifier is set in the series statement.
* either the default value is removed for the sub-field
* or it is removed from the original reference main field

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.6.1`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Cancellation of a request leads in some cases to the wrong item status

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: effort: 2pt
labels.description: 2 point of effort estimated for the implementation

labels.name: client request
labels.description: Issue reported by production libraries

body:
**Describe the bug**

Cancellation of a request leads in some cases to the wrong item status. This concerns the action `CANCEL_REQUEST_4_1_2` (see [spec here](https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/master/doc/circulation/actions.md)).

> 1. __CANCEL_REQUEST_4__: item in_transit (IN_TRANSIT_FOR_PICKUP)
> 	1. __CANCEL_REQUEST_4_1__: loan to cancel = current loan
> 		1. __CANCEL_REQUEST_4_1_1__: PENDING loan does not exist → (update loan, item is: in_transit (IN_TRANSIT_TO_HOUSE))
> 		1. __CANCEL_REQUEST_4_1_2__: PENDING loan exists → (cancel loan, item is: in_transit (IN_TRANSIT_FOR_PICKUP))[automatic validate logic is applied next PENDING loan] 
> 	1. __CANCEL_REQUEST_4_2__: loan to cancel != current loan → (cancel loan, item is: in_transit (IN_TRANSIT_FOR_PICKUP))

When cancelling a loan that is in transit for pickup, and the next pending loan has a pick-up location equals to the item location, the loan becomes "ITEM_AT_DESK". This is wrong, because the item is de facto still in transit.

**To Reproduce**

1. Login at library L1
1. Add a request for patron P1 on item I1 of your own library, with pick-up location L2/1 (not in library L1)
1. Add a request for patron P2 on same item, with pick-up location L1/1 (within your login library L1)
1. Validate the request for P1 > the item goes "in transit for pick-up"
1. Cancel the request for P1 > the item goes "at desk", this is not correct

**Expected behavior**

In case of a `CANCEL_REQUEST_4_1_2`, the item stays "in transit" and the next loan becomes "IN_TRANSIT_FOR_PICKUP".

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.5.1`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

body:
**Describe the bug**

Account global view is not updated correctly after:

1. changing the account in an order line:
    * the amounts of the new account are displayed correctly
    * the amounts of the previous account: engagements are not updated
2. cancelling the order line

**To Reproduce**

A.
1. Create an order line of 20.- linked to account A
2. Account global view: engagement of account A = 20.-
3. Modify the order line and link it to account B
4. Account global view: engagement of account B is correct (20.-) but engagement of account A not (still 20.-, should be 0.-)

B.
1. Create an order line, with an amount and an account
2. Give it the status "cancelled"
3. See account global view

**Expected behavior**

A. Account global view: engagements are updated in previous and new account.
B. Remove status "cancelled" (to be confirmed)

Not clear. Maybe the problem happens with all 2nd reminders. See example.

**Expected behavior**

The reminder number is the same in the two places.

```txt
Sujet : 1er rappel
--
De : "noreply@rero.ch" <noreply@rero.ch>

Patron pid: 64434
Street number
2800 DELEMONT

Chère lectrice, cher lecteur,

Vous pouvez consulter votre compte et prolonger la durée de prêt de vos documents à l'adresse : [...]

Avec nos compliments

Rue de l'Hôpital 47, 2800 Delémont
```

title: Creating an item template from an existing item creates errors

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Creating an item template from an existing item creates errors: holdings/document/library/status are saved in the template but should not
    * if the holdings, for ex, is deleted, the template is then broken
    * if a status "on loan" is saved in the item, the item has this status but no loan linked to it

**To Reproduce**

Case 1: document link
1. Look for an existing item
2. Edit it
3. Save it as a template
4. Delete the item and its corresponding holdings
5. Try to display and use the template

Case 2: status
1. Look for an existing item
2. Do a checkout
3. Edit the item
4. Save it as a template
5. Create another item with this template
6. See the wrong item status

**Expected behavior**

Fields holdings/document/library/status are not saved in the template. Check also for other fields, and other templates.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.4.11`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Availability sent to the owning library instead of the pickup

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

If a patron with mail as communication channel, requested an item that is getting the status *item at desk*, the availability notice is sent to the library that owns the item, instead of the pickup library.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to <https://ils.test.rero.ch>.
2. Log in as a patron.
3. Verify that the communication channel is mail (not e-mail).
4. In another tab or browser, log in as a system librarian (Astrid).
5. Search for a patron that has borrowed items and select one of them.
6. With the patron of point 2, request this item, with a pickup != from the owning.
7. With the system librarian, verify the notification settings of both libraries, in order to know to with e-mail the notifications are supposed to be sent.
8. Return the item in the pickup location. It's now *item at desk*.
9. Verify that the request notification is sent to the library where the item has been returned.
10. Verify that the availability notification is wrongly sent to the library that owns the item.

**Expected behavior**

The availability notification should be sent to the pickup library.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] .
* version: `v1.4.9`.

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: public interface : too many clicks to get all items of a holding

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v1.4.8
milestone.description: Possible fix

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the public interface, when a document has several holdings, they are "closed" by default.
If you open a holding with multiple items, it displays only the first item, and a "Show more" link. 
You need to click every time on "Show more" to get the next item in the list.
If you have a holding, with 10 items, you have to click 11 times (1x to open the holding, 10x to see all items)

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to https://bib.rero.ch/global/documents/199257
2. try to open the holding of Neuchâtel ("Bibliothèque des Pasteurs") with 18 items.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16501502/130809870-5eda2119-7d88-486b-9a67-ccbcc7f6c397.png)

**Expected behavior**

The user needs 1 click to open the holding, then 1 click to get the first 10 items, then a "show more" to get the next 10. etc...

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.4.7`

title: Server error if the checkout is made from a library that does not have any pick-up location

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Server error if the checkout is made from a library that does not have any pick-up location.

Linked issue: #2419

**To Reproduce**

1. Log in in library A
2. Remove all pick-up locations of library A
3. Do a checkout
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

Pick-up locations of the transaction library have no impact on the checkout.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] (v1.4.6) AND [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2] (v1.4.7)

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

**Additional context**

Error received in console:
`error: None is not of type 'string' Failed validating 'type' in schema['properties']['transaction_location_pid']: {'title': 'Transaction location PID', 'type': 'string'}On instance['transaction_location_pid']: None`

title: Reset password notification sent when changing/adding a user e-mail

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: client request
labels.description: Issue reported by production libraries

body:
**Describe the bug**

A reset password notification is sent when changing/adding a user e-mail from the professional interface.

**To Reproduce**

1. Open a user with e-mail in the professional interface
2. Edit the user (personal data)
3. Change the e-mail and save the user
4. See that the user received a notification "Reset password" on the new e-mail address

**Expected behavior**

The reset password notification is sent only when clicking on "Forgot password?"

No reset password notification is sent for any other user/patron modification.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.4.6`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Impossible to save a duplicated document that does not contain all default values

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Impossible to save a duplicated document that does not contain all default values. Example: saving a duplicated article is impossible, because an article does not contain a publication statement (`provisionActivity.statement`).

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a document with a missing or incomplete publication statement
2. Duplicate this document
3. Try to save
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

Default values on optional fields should not prevent to save a resource without these optional fields.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.4.6`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

body:
**Describe the bug**

Reminders notifications are not generated correctly. For a due date on 2021-08-14, only one reminder should have been generated, but they are all (1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th) generated, merged and sent in the same notification, even if the communication channel is different (4th should be per mail).

See example. 

**To Reproduce**

See example

**Expected behavior**

Notifications are grouped only if they have
* same recipient (either library or patron) AND same communication channel

Reminder notifications are generated on the right date.

**Context**

* server: <https://bib.rero.ch>
* version: `v1.4.6`

**Example**

Due date of all items is 14.08.
One of the loans: https://bib.rero.ch/api/loans/160064 - vs

title: Availability notification: wrong recipient or notification not sent at all

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Availability notification is sent to the wrong recipient (to the library instead of the patron) or is not sent at all.

**To Reproduce**

1. Take an item
2. Add 1 request for patron A with pick-up X
3. Add 1 request for patron B with pick-up Y
4. Add 1 request for patron C with pick-up Z
5. Make sure all patrons A/B/C have e-mail as communication channel
6. Checkout the item for A
7. Checkin the item at location Y
8. Same happens for the second patron C

Try to reproduce the case with patrons that have "mail" as communication channel, or e-mail but with only an additional communication e-mail.

**Expected behavior**

The availability notification is sent:
* to the patron if communication channel is "e-mail" and there is an e-mail OR communication e-mail
* else to the library with addressee block

This logic should apply to all notifications sent to patrons: reminders, due_soon, recall, availability.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.4.6`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Request list: all items with a temporary circulation category are hidden

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Request list: all items with a temporary circulation category are hidden.

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Create an item that can be requested, or take an existing one
2. Add him a temporary circulation category with `negative_availability:true`
    * See that it is not in the request list (`/professional/circulation/requests`) > correct
3. Change the item to have a temporary circulation category with `negative_availability:false`
    * See that it is not in the request list (`/professional/circulation/requests`) > **it should be because it is available**

**Expected behavior**

Request list:
* items with a temporary circulation category with `negative_availability:true` **should not** be part of this list
* items with a temporary circulation category with `negative_availability:false` **should** be part of this list

The list should display the same request that are addressed by the notification `request`. The conditions should be coded together/factored.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.4.6`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Wrong pick-up location name in the booking notification

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

body:
**Describe the bug**

Some booking notifications have the wrong pick-up location name. It seems that the pick-up name to be inserted in the notification is taken in a previous loan instead of the current loan.

**To Reproduce**

1. Choose an item
2. Add a request for patron A with pick-up location A -> a correct request notification is sent
3. Add a request for patron B with pick-up location B
4. Add a request for patron C with pick-up location C
5. Check-out the item for patron A
6. Check-in the item and see the generated booking notification: it has A as pick-up location
7. If you do a checkout for B and then a checkin, see that the new booking notification still has A as pick-up location

**Expected behavior**

The pick-up location name in the notification is correct.

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.4.6`

**Example**

> Date: 2 août 2021, 15:21:17
> 
> Titre: Chut pas un bruit ! (dragon endormi) / [texte] Bianca Schulze
> 
> Code-barre: 1012321218
> Localisation: VOUVRY - Bibliothèque municipale et scolaire / Albums enfants
> Cote: SCHU
> 
> Lieu de retrait: Vouvry - Bibliothèque municipale et scolaire
> Lecteur: 2011014071

Concerns
* these circulation operations: https://bib.rero.ch/api/operation_logs/?q=loan.pid:172524%20AND%20loan.patron.pid:24430
* this item: https://bib.rero.ch/api/items/3076865

title: Delayed availability notification don't take into account the new loan state

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Stale or no longer relevant

body:
**How it works**

In the library, it is possible to set a delay for sending the availability notification. The aim was to have enough time to cancel the request if the item is defect.

But apparently the system sends the availability notification even when the request is cancelled during the delay.

To reproduce:

1. Put a delay (for ex. 5 min) in a library. It is already the case for "Bibliothèque du Lycée de la Vallée d'Aoste".
2. Create a request to pick-up in this library
3. Validate the request: it is "At desk" and a notification is prepared
4. Cancel the request before the end of the delay
5. See that the notification is still sent

**How it should works**

When sending the notification, the system checks that the item is still "AT_DESK" for the corresponding patron. If not, the notification is not sent

title: The item or the loan has not been indexed after a checkin.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

body:
**Describe the bug**

The item or the loan has not been indexed after a checkin:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/127472475-a138707f-be98-41c7-876d-0e4ca9d98f06.png)

The checkout of this item is blocked.

After analysis, this seems linked to overdue fees set in the circulation policy of CHF 0.-

**To Reproduce**

Item: https://bib.rero.ch/professional/records/items/detail/3011874
Loan: https://bib.rero.ch/api/loans/?q=pid:5335 (Bulle)
Patron: https://bib.rero.ch/professional/records/patrons/detail/7625

**Expected behavior**

No empty line with spinner appears in the patron account.
It is possible to checkout this item.

After analysis:
* it is not possible to set 0 as fee amount in a circulation policy in: `reminder.fee_amount` AND `overdue_fees.intervals.fee_amount`

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch

body:
**Describe the bug**

When connected as a librarian working at BPUN (RBNJ), it impossible to create request for patrons on every item that are not owned by the BPUN library. The BPUN library deactivate request on its own items during holidays.

The pickup location does not matter, for every pickup the request is impossible.

-> Hypothesis: if the pick-up location of the login library does not allow the requests, there are server errors.

**To Reproduce**

1. Log in as a librarian in the professional interface (try on bib.test.rero.ch).
2. Verify the selected library is BPUN.
3. Find an item to request in the professional interface.
4. Try to place a request for a patron. See the error. (See screenshot below).

**Expected behavior**

The request should succed.

From the patron point of view, any request with a pickup libary of the BPUN will also fail.

title: Due date not computed correcty (also after renewal)

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

Case 1: Renewal date is sometime one day later than checkout date, and does not respect the open days of the library.

Case 2: The loan duration is not exactly the same than in the circulation policy (in general 1 or 2 days longer) and does not respect the library open days.

**To Reproduce**

Case 1
1. Take a patron account
2. Use two items with the same item type.
3. Set the same loan and renewal duration (for inst. 28 days for both)
4. Do a renewal on one item and a checkout on the other
5. See the different due dates

Case 2
1. Log in bib.rero.ch as a Valais professional
2. Do a checkout for a standard patron with a standard item (should be a 28 days checkout)
    * use item barcode `test_rero` on patron.pid `223550`
3. See that the due date is not correct

**Expected behavior**

Due date respects the circulation policy settings and the library open days.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] and production
* version: `v1.4.3`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

When we tried to compile the UI project `public-holdings-items`, an error occurred.
It is now impossible to work/correct this project.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to `rero/dev` branch of the *rero-ils-ui* project.
2. `npm ci`
3. `npm run start-public-holdings-items-proxy`
4. See error.

```
git fetch -p --all
git checkout dev
git reset --hard rero/dev
git push -f

npm ci  --> OK
ng build shared (ou ng build --project shared) --> OK
npm run start-public-holdings-items-proxy --> Error: Maximum call stack size exceeded
```

**Additional infos**

It seems to be a dependencies problem.
When we use the https://github.com/rero/rero-ils-ui/commit/e671bb8ee07bc640c7af0149b4b35f4da514ff95 commit, the compilation succeed.
The next commit update dependencies, and compilation failed.

**Expected behavior**

Compilation should succeed.

**Context**

* server: [localhost][1]
* version: *rero-ils-ui* `v0.16.5`

[1]: https://localhost:4201

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10031585/125748606-803a84d9-3f09-4830-870e-87d6e12747a1.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10031585/125748708-32552282-4f11-4819-92e5-73db56c1bb64.png)

title: Removing a pick-up location creates bugs on the loans

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

body:
**Describe the bug**

There is a location marked as pick-up. Some loans exist to pick-up from this location. If we disable the pick-up field of the locations, the circulation interface doesn't work anymore with these loans.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a request on item X to pick-up from location Y
2. Edit location Y and remove the pick-up property
3. Check-in item X
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

* It is possible to edit a pick-up location (enable/disable) without affecting circulation: all operations should work.

With a loan with a pick-up location that is no more "pick-up", the interface should behave as follows:
* Pick-up name, ideally display in cascade: "[name of the library]: [location that is no more pick-up]"
    * to be corrected everywhere: in flash messages, in request list, in patron account (public/pro), in item detailed view (request queue), etc.

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.4.1`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: It should not be possible to delete an item type with linked items

labels.name: bug (critical)
labels.description: Blocking issue, should be fixed ASAP

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

body:
**Describe the bug**

Currently, it is possible to delete an item type linked to an item through the `temporary_item_type` field.
It is not possible if the item type is linked though field `item_type`.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create an item type X
2. Add an new item to a document
3. Set an existing item type and add X as `temporary_item_type`
4. Delete X
5. Try to display the item detailed view or the document detailed view. There is an error.

**Expected behavior**

* Removing an item type linked to an item via the `temporary_item_type` field is not possible.
* Existing item linked to a deleted item types are corrected. Example in bib.rero.ch: barcode:1011368274

**Context**

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.4.1`

title: Request is sent to the wrong e-mail and even if the document is on loan

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

labels.name: production
labels.description: Issue specifically spotted on the production server

body:
**Describe the bug**

A) `request` notifications are sent to the wrong e-mail
B) `request` notifications are sent when the item is on loan (should not)
C) some patron notifications (due_soon, availability, reminders, recall) are sent to the library (should be sent to the patron)
D) `booking` notifications are sometimes not sent

See examples below.

**To Reproduce**

To be completed according to examples.

**Expected behavior**

A) Requests: they are always sent to
1. E-mail specified in the item location: `notification_email` (if `send_notification`=true)
2. Else: e-mail specified in the library: `notification_settings.email` (if `type`=request)
3. Else: not sent

B) `request` notifications are sent when a request is done AND the item is on shelf (no active loan, no other pending loan).

C) Patron notifications (due_soon, availability, reminders, recall) are
1. Sent to patron if communication chanel is e-mail (to main e-mail, to additional e-mail, or to both if applicable)
2. Else: sent to library

D) `booking` notifications are sent.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->

* server: bib.rero.ch
* version: `v1.4.1`

**Examples**

* (B) this item is on loan. No "request" notification should be sent for it.

body:
**Describe the bug**

When loading an empty document editor, in the network tab of the browser tools, I see a request `GET https://bib.rero.ch/schemas/documents` with an 500 error response.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to <https://bib.rero.ch/professional>.
2. Log in as a librarian.
3. Open the browser inspector, network tab.
4. Navigate to <https://bib.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/new>.
5. Look for errors in the list of requests, on `document`.

**Expected behavior**

The document JSON schema request should be fulfilled.

**Context**

* server: <https://bib.rero.ch>
* version: `v1.4.1`.

The error does not occur on <https://ils.test.rero.ch>, `v1.4.1`.

The spinner loops and the console contains an error message "ERROR TypeError: this.loan.metadata.item_pid is undefined" (similar to point above / benerken)

body: **Describe the bug** When adding the "Uniform resource locator" field when adding a document, the "Content type" field is present although it is optional. When editing a record that contains the "Uniform resource locator" field, the "Content type" field is present even if the value is not in the data. Generally, this problem happens with: * document: * `electronicLocator.content` * `scale.type` * holdings: * `max_number_of_claims` * `days_before_first_claim` * `days_before_next_claim` **To Reproduce** 1. Go to 'https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/detail/1028' 2. Edit the record 3. Jump to "Uniform resource locators" 4. Remove "Content type" field on element 5. Save record 6. Edit this record 7. Jump to "Uniform resource locators" 8. you see the "Content type" field even though there is no data **Expected behavior** If the field or sub-field is empty in the existing resource, it stays empty when editing the resouce. **Context** * server: [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2] * version: `v1.3.1`. [2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch **Screenshots**

**Describe the bug**

When searching for document through the "import from web" interface and filtering the result, selecting a document type reveals an empty subtype select box. Worse, the results are not displayed anymore.

title: Translations extraction script should take escape char into account

labels.name: translations
labels.description: Translations

labels.name: f: data
labels.description: About data model, importation, transformation, exportation of data, specific for bibliographic data

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Stale or no longer relevant

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the JSON schema, values are extracted by the translation extraction script. In some case, the value contains double quotes that are escaped, such as:

https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/dev/rero_ils/modules/item_types/jsonschemas/item_types/item_type-v0.0.1.json#L164

    "description": "This optional text is displayed in the public interface, for instance \"On-site consultation\""

The escape is not taken into account resulting in:

https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/1867add1f25fbef3f1034426306b899c5d6e1c7f/rero_ils/translations/eo/LC_MESSAGES/messages.po#L9270

    msgid "This optional text is displayed in the public interface, for instance \\"

Concern:

- https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/rero_plus/rero-ils/fr/?checksum=2aead33de5cd9f52
- https://hosted.weblate.org/translate/rero_plus/rero-ils/fr/?checksum=4f41bd39063607f8

**To Reproduce**

Check the specified strings.

**Expected behavior**

The extracted string should take the escape into account:

    msgid "This optional text is displayed in the public interface, for instance "On-site consultation""

If it's not possible, propose another solution.

**Context**

* version: `v1.2.0`.

title: The limit by overdue items is activated while the loans are not yet overdue

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

The limit by overdue items on the item type is activated too early while the loans are not yet overdue.

**To Reproduce**

1. Edit item type X
2. Set a limit by overdue item to 3 and save
3. Create 4 items with item type X
4. Open the checkout form for a patron
5. Select a fix date for the same day (if it is not possible, adapt the opening hours of the library so that it is open this day)
5. Check out these 4 items (for the end of the current day)
6. See that the 4th item cannot be checked out because of the limit

**Expected behavior**

The limit by overdue items is activated only when the loans are really overdue.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] or [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]?
* version: `v1.2.0`.

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

**Screenshots**

Limit on patron type on overdue items (`limits.overdue_items_limits`) is set to 3, the 4th item cannot be checked out.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/121361481-9d091580-c935-11eb-9657-4cc6200ee95c.png)

Same configuration, but only two of the 3 loans are for the current day, the 4th loan is allowed.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/121366964-30dce080-c93a-11eb-9122-b10ce5629af4.png)

body: Item status remains on_shelf after creating ITEM_ON_LOAN loan for the item. title: Two API requests for on search query on the global search

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

As a user enter a search query on the global page search, two API requests occur, thus doubling the loading time of the page.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to the global search
2. Enter an empty search
3. Inspect the network
4. See error

**Expected behavior**

Only one API request should be made.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] or [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]?
* version: `v1.2.0`.

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch

title: When editing an item of a document with lots of holdings and items, ES takes to much time

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug (critical)
labels.description: Blocking issue, should be fixed ASAP

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

When I edit this item (https://ilspilotdev.test.rero.ch/professional/records/items/edit/1612144), I receive an error "The form contains error". But the changes are saved.

This does not happen with other issues or standard items.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/119617410-1ebf5600-be02-11eb-8d1f-41229da93d90.png)

**The issue is that ES takes too much time (because of too much records to reindex, see below) and the client closes the connexion.**

**To Reproduce**

1. Log in as an admin in organisation "Bulle"
2. Edit https://ilspilotdev.test.rero.ch/professional/records/items/edit/1612144
3. Try to save

**Expected behavior**

It is possible to save the changes without error message.

**Context**

* server: ilspilotdev.test.rero.ch (will be soon ilspilot.test.rero.ch)
* version: `v1.2.0`

**Additional information**

This document contains 23 holdings and fast 1000 items. Updating on item (even with no modification) result in reindexing the whole document stack (document/contributions/holdings/items), which takes too much time. **As this is a regular use case, another method has to be implemented.**

title: Impossible to save a document when created with a template

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug

body:
**Describe the bug**

The document form cannot be saved when it was opened with this specific template (it does not give any explanations to the end user, see screenshot): https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/templates/detail/185

```json
{"created":"2021-05-14T15:10:51.157549+00:00","id":"185","links":{"self":"https://ils.test.rero.ch/api/templates/185"},"metadata":{"$schema":"https://ils.rero.ch/schemas/templates/template-v0.0.1.json","creator":{"$ref":"https://ils.rero.ch/api/patrons/16"},"data":{"$schema":"https://ils.rero.ch/schemas/documents/document-v0.0.1.json","_masked":false,"adminMetadata":{"descriptionLanguage":"fre","encodingLevel":"Full level"},"contentMediaCarrier":[{"carrierType":"rdact:1049","contentType":["rdaco:1020"],"mediaType":"rdamt:1007"}],"contribution":[{"agent":{"date_of_birth":"19..-....","preferred_name":"Nom, pr\u00e9nom","type":"bf:Person"},"role":["aut"]}],"extent":"xxx pages","genreForm":[{"identifiedBy":{"type":"rero-rameau","value":"A021121540"},"source":"rero","term":"[Roman policier]","type":"bf:Topic"}],"identifiedBy":[{"type":"bf:Ean","value":"0000000000"}],"issuance":{"main_type":"rdami:1001","subtype":"materialUnit"},"language":[{"type":"bf:Language","value":"fre"}],"pid":"2019394","provisionActivity":[{"place":[{"country":"fr","type":"bf:Place"}],"startDate":2021,"statement":[{"label":[{"value":"[Lieu]"}],"type":"bf:Place"},{"label":[{"value":"nom de l'\u00e9diteur"}],"type":"bf:Agent"},{"label":[{"value":"[2021]"}],"type":"Date"}],"type":"bf:Publication"}],"responsibilityStatement":[[{"value":"mention de responsabilit\u00e9"}]],"seriesStatement":[{"seriesTitle":[{"value":"collection xxx"}]}],"title":[{"mainTitle":[{"value":"titre propre"}],"subtitle":[{"value":"sous-titre"}],"type":"bf:Title"}],"type":[{"main_type":"docmaintype_book","subtype":"docsubtype_other_book"}]},"name":"[CLT] mod\u00e8le formation livre roman policier","organisation":{"$ref":"https://ils.rero.ch/api/organisations/3"},"pid":"185","template_type":"documents","visibility":"public"},"updated":"2021-05-14T15:11:17.683668+00:00"}
```

With other templates, it works.

**To Reproduce**

1. Log in as reroilstest+imagination@gmail.com (organisation 3)
2. Use this template
3. Fill the fields and try to save (impossible)
4. Remove all fields except the required ones and try to save (impossible)

**Expected behavior**

* It is possible to save a document using this template.
* The form explains to the end user what the error is.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.2.0`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/118436521-3d766c00-b6e1-11eb-836a-85d115a2cf83.png)

body:
<!--
    Please, fill the bug report as precisely as possible.
    Write a full sentence in the issue title.
    Thanks a lot for helping us!
-->

**Describe the bug**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->

Sometimes, when trying to add local fields on a document, as the librarian click on the *add local fields* button, the system respond with a 401 error. It may happen 30 minutes after the initialization of the application, but this has to be confirmed.

If the librarian navigate elsewhere or reload the page, he/she can add the local fields.

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Log in as a librarian or system librarian in the professional interface.
2. Display a document detailed view (not an ebook) and open the local fields tab.
3. Wait 30 minutes.
3. Click on the *add local fields* button.
4. See error.

**Expected behavior**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

At every moment, the authenticated professional should be able to add local fields on a document.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] or [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2].
* version: `v1.2.0`.

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

**Screenshots**

<!--
    If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
-->

**Additional context**

This could be linked to the guard (`/projects/admin/src/app/guard/can-add-local-fields.guard.ts`) on the local fields form. This guard seach for the current user organisation in the local storage, that expire after 30 minutes. And the datastore seem cleared herd: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils-ui/blob/0776afc6cd6412d719d27835ee6eb83e6815df1f/projects/admin/src/app/service/app-router-event.service.ts#L63

labels.name: bug

body:
<!--
    Please, fill the bug report as precisely as possible.
    Write a full sentence in the issue title.
    Thanks a lot for helping us!
-->

**List of bugs**

- [x] [ @jma on it] All persons and corporates bodies detailed views of the public interface crash (internal server error). PR: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/pull/1874
- [x] https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/1895 [not blocking] ILL resquest of the public interface is accessible for non patron users such as librarians and it should not be the case. When a non patron user fill in the form, this results in an internal server error.

title: Multiple checkouts is possible on same item for the same patron

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: developers
labels.description: From a developer point of view.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Stale or no longer relevant

body:
A new record `loan` is normally created in DB when a `checkout` action is done for an item `A` and a patron `B`.  
The `invenio-circulation` module does prevent users from creating new `loans` for the same pair. However if you try to use the method `Loan.create` to create a new `loan` for the same pair it will work.

When this happens, you can end up having as much loans as you want in the DB for the same pair and for the same `loan.state`. This breaks and corrupt completely the circulation module and its data. 

Some measures need to be be put in place to prevent this from happening. It is true that only the `sysadmin` staff have the access to the `Loan.create` method, but at least need to create some kind of protection.


**To Reproduce**

1. in the frontend, `checkout` item `A` to patron `B`,  
2. try to `checkout` the same item to the same patron, transaction will fail because item is already checked-out.
3. using the backend, try to create a new `loan` using the method `Loan.create` for the same pair above and the loan.state=ITEM_ON_LOAN
4. repeat the step 3 as many times as you want.
5. You end up check-out the same item for the same patron multiple times
6. same goes for other types of transactions `requests`, `renewals`...

**Expected behaviour**

Only on active `loan` is allowed for item/patron in DB.

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] or [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]?
* version: `v1.2.0` 

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Unable to create circulation policies with different loan period for 2 different libraries

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

The CIPO editor doesn't allow to create 2 CIPO with the same conditions (patron type/item type),
with different loan periods, for 2 different libraries.

**To Reproduce**

1. Go to ilsdev, login with Astrid, Go to the professional interface.

In the CIPO editor, you create a CIPO called "X1" with a loan period of 10 days. 
You can indicate it applies to selected patron types and item types, and for a specific library (AOSTE-CANT1) => OK

Let's say you want to create a CIPO, called "X2",  with a loan period of 5 days, for another library (AOSTE-LYCEE)
You can't indicate it applies to patron types and item types because they are already selected in CIPO X1.

**Expected behavior**

In the CIPO Editor, the admin user must be able to create CIPOs for different libraries, with different loan periods, for the same patron types/item types.

* version: v1.1.0

body:
**Describe the bug**
When deleting the last item of a record, there is 2 confirmation messages "Do you really want to delete this record?" and we need to refresh the page to activate the "Delete" button of the bibliographic record. 

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Go to a record with only one item
2. Delete the last item
3. See the 2 confirmation messages that follow each other (one for the item, one for the holding I guess). If you confirm the delete for the 2nd messages, it spins forever.
4. See that the "Delete" button of the bibliographic record is not activate. You need to refresh the page.

**Expected behavior**
There should be only one confirmation message. The holding is deleted automatically if there is no more item attached.
The "delete" button should then be automatically activated (as there is no item attached).

body:
<!--
    Please, fill the bug report as precisely as possible.
    Write a full sentence in the issue title.
    Thanks a lot for helping us!
-->

**Describe the bug**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
As a user, even if I change the 'keep history' settings, my loan history is not saved.
In my personal data tab, it still displays 'The loan history is not saved'.
It is the same as a librarian. I can modify the setting for a user but it is not taken into account.
Note: The 'keep history' settings is displayed as enabled in the edition form of the public and the professional interface.

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Log is as a patron.
2. Go to 'My account'
3. Modify the personal data.

Or modify the history settings as a librarian and make some loan transactions.

**Expected behavior**

<!--
    A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The user should see a loan history tab.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->
