title: Notifications and fees don't respect the circulation policy settings

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the screenshot 1, a fixed date checkout was made. Due date on 03.03.21. Default policy applies for reminders and fees. The default policy defines `due_soon` 5 days before due date, and 1st `overdue` 5 days after due date. In this case, the notifications didn't respect the settings.

In the screenshot 2, the item 10000000995 is borrowed under the circulation policy "Short", defining `due_soon` 5 days before due date, and 1st `overdue` 5 days after due date. In this case, the notifications didn't respect the settings:
* `due_soon` was actually sent 4 day before, instead of 5
* `overdue` should have been sent on 02.03.21 but wasn't.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a loan
2. Check the notification dates

**Expected behavior**

The settings applied for notifications, fees and renewals, come from the circulation policy corresponding to patron type/item type.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.0.1`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch

**Screenshots**

1.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/109771730-75e7cd00-7bfd-11eb-927f-496efaf709db.png)

2.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/109773165-27d3c900-7bff-11eb-9d4f-83b70e9971d4.png)

'www.sag-ssa.ch/fr-fr/' does not match '^(ftps?|https?)://.*$'

labels.name: f: data

labels.description: Public interface, as opposed to the professional interface

body:
**Describe the bug**
Online access to records with a "Uniform Resource Locator" field does not appear in the public interface.

**To Reproduce**
1. Go to the public interface
2. Find a record with "Uniform resource Locator" (ex. : Lettres d'un François)
3. Look at the "Get" tabs
3. See that there is no online holding and the full text link is missing.

**Expected behavior**

* The tab "Online access" is removed.
* The field `electronicLocator` is displayed in the public and professional interface, document detailed view, on top of the page:
  * an icon "fa-link" is displayed before each link
   * links of type "resource" are always displayed on top of the list
   * Link text: concatenation of `type`: `content`. Translations for `type`:
     * "resource": Online access
     * "versionOfResource": Other online version
     * "relatedResource": Related resource
     * "hiddenUrl": Hidden URL
     * "noInfo": Related resource
  * `note` is always displayed in parenthesis after the link
  * `url` is not displayed but used to set the link
  * "hiddenUrl" are only displayed in the professional interface

Examples (orange: type; green: content; red: note):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/110436459-8e9c2b00-80b4-11eb-9e96-b8998f00999a.png)

**Context**
* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] and [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]
* version: `v1.0.0`

[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: 2nd-level values of hierarchical facets are not always sorted according to their parent value

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

A document can have a repetitive document type (main type + subtype). In this case, if it has 2 different main types, this generates a problem in the facet (see screenshot).

Example: a document has the following main types/subtypes: `a/1` + `b/2`. If the main type `a` is selected in the facet, `1` is then proposed as sub-facet, but `2` is also proposed.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a document with two different main type, and two different subtypes
2. Save it
3. Do a search using the document type facet, and selecting one of the main type of this document.
4. See the subtypes proposed

**Expected behavior**

`2` should not be proposed as subfacet of `a`.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v1.0.0`

body:
**Describe the bug**

Some issues not received don't get the "late" status after the field `days_before_first_claim` is achieved.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a holdings with an expected issue for the same day and 
2. Set the field `days_before_first_claim` to 1

All issues get the "late" status when they are expected and when they achieved the number of days before first claim.

title: Receive an issue: confusion between the status date and the date of receipt

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When you manually change a status with "Receive and edit this issue", the status date is not shown. A "date of receipt" is indicated, but this if the status is "late", this issue is not yet received (it's the status date, not the date of receipt).

**To Reproduce**
1. Find a serial with expected issues.
2. Click on 'Receive and edit this issue'.
3. Change the status to "late" and save.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The status date should shown even when the status is changed manually (it's ok with "quick receive").
The date of receipt should only be used for the "received" status. If the issue is late or claimed, the date of receipt should be "Not yet received".

**Context**
server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] (v. 0.15.0) and [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55576980/106249663-f38d7700-6212-11eb-9402-bec919a5fe5e.png)

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Cannot add new fields to a duplicate bibliographic record

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When duplicating a bibliographic records, the editor opens a new record with the bibliographic information of the original record. In the editor, I'm unable to add new fields to it. I can chose a new field with the "Add fields" menu, but it doesn't show in the editor. The "Add fields" menu contains all fields, not taking into account it's presence in the record.

**To Reproduce**
1. Choose a bibliographic record
2. Click on 'Duplicate'
3. In the new record editor, try to add a field that is not already in the record.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The "Add field" menu should only contains the missing field of the bibliographic record.
When clicking on a field to add, it should be added to the editor in order to be able to complete it.

**Context**
Problem appears on ils.test.rero.ch
version: v0.15.0

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**

I have a circulation policy with all toggle disabled (checkout, request, reminders, etc.). Example: cipo "No checkout": https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/circ_policies/detail/9

When I enable a toggle and fill the field, I cannot save the form anymore. I have to enable and disable all toggle to be able to save the form.

**To Reproduce**

1. Edit cipo "No checkout": https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/circ_policies/detail/9
2. Enable checkout for 2 days
3. Try to save
4. Activate and deactivate all other toggles
5. Try to save

**Expected behavior**

I don't have to touch the other toggles to save the form.

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v0.15.0`

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch

body:
**Describe the bug**

The canceled request is displayed in the history tab of the professional patron account. In the public patron account, it is not. 

Actually it says checkin/checkout but it is not correct because it is just a request. [LATER? we should be able to differenciate the transactions : request, checkin, checkout ...] This problem is linked to https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/1227.

public interface:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12396034/100464497-0201ca00-30ce-11eb-9c2e-355ead4e4aa2.png)

professional interface:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12396034/100464460-f1515400-30cd-11eb-84d9-fd99e913c1a2.png)

**To Reproduce**

<!--
    Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->

1. Log in as a patron and check your profile. Ex: Katie.
2. Cancel a pending request.
3. Compare the history tab of the public & professional interface.

**Expected behavior**

We should have the same information both side: no display of the cancelled requests in the history tab.

**Context**

<!--
    Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using which browser:
-->

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch]
* version: `v0.14.1`

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the professional interface, the main search autocomplete gives suggestions in German or French according to the interface language. This is not the case in the public interface (see screenshots).

This principle works fine in the author facet and in the various document displays.

**To Reproduce**

1. Create a document and link it to the organisation "Suisse. Conseil fédéral"
1. Look for "conseil fédéral" in the public main search
    * once in German
    * once in French

**Expected behavior**

In German, suggestion is "Schweiz. Bundesrat".
In French, suggestion is "Suisse. Conseil fédéral".

**Context**


* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v0.14.1`
* browser: Firefox 83.0, Chrome 87

Professional interface

title: circulation: add control on circulation operation

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: Last RERO ILS release before the first `v1.0.0`!

body:
Closes rero/rero-ils#1470
If a circulation policy disallow checkout operation, the error message
returned was not user friendly. This commit add a check for checkout
operation on cipo; this check return a better error message.

Closes rero/rero-ils#1383
If a patron is blocked for any reasons, this user couldn't extend any
active loan.

Closes rero/rero-ils#1507
Fixes 'status' facet problem on items result list. Despite if user
choose a status to faceting the results, the facet value didn't apply.

Co-Authored-by: Renaud Michotte <renaud.michotte@gmail.com>

## Code review check list

- [ ] Commit message template compliance.
- [ ] Commit message without typos.
- [ ] File names.
- [ ] Functions names.
- [ ] Functions docstrings.
- [ ] Unnecessary commited files?

A project is created to see the progress of this peculiar milestone: https://github.com/orgs/rero/projects/6?fullscreen=true

body:
**Describe the bug**
When I load a prediction pattern on an existing holding and try to save, it spins forever.
It works for a new holding.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12396034/99685255-ab1f4380-2a82-11eb-8e68-2e8f9dc48383.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  Find a serial.
2. Edit the holding and load a prediction pattern. Ex : https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/holdings/edit/2012?source=templates&pid=31
3. Try to save.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
We should have a reason why it doesn't save. Fields missing?

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1] or [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2]?
* version: `v0.14.0` 

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch

title: Error message when checking out a 'no checkout' item should be useful to the librarian

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to checkout an item not allowed to be checked out, I get an error 403 with the following message.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12396034/99677737-58418e00-2a7a-11eb-8d03-6548efa68f09.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in as a librarian or system librarian.
2. Find an item 'no  checkout'. Ex: https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/items/detail/43
3. Select a user and try to checkout the item.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The system shouldn't calculate a loan duration for those items.
Instead, It should display something like 'Transaction denied. The circulation policy disallows the loan for this item.' (to be discussed)

**Context**

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1]
* version: `v0.14.0` 

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch

title: Creating a patron with a username and an email corresponding to two different invenio user cause unpredictable errors

labels.name: effort: important
labels.description: US candidate

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When a patron record is created by a librarian the system try to link an existing invenio user account to this patron record. If the username and the email correspond to two different invenio users, the system create the link with only one invenio user account.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Register a new rero user with a username.
2. Register a second rero user with an email address.
3. Log in with a librarian.
4. Create a new patron with the username and email used to register the two previous rero users.
5. No errors is notified.

**Expected behaviour**
The librarian should link explicitly a patron to a invenio user account.

body:
**Describe the bug**
A patron without an email cannot change his personal information such as address, city, etc.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in with an patron without email account.
2. Go to the RERO ID personal information form.
3. Try to change the address.
4. The form cannot be submitted as the email is required.

labels.name: p-Medium

body:
**Describe the bug**
When a patron update his email in the patron RERO ID form, the email is not updated in the librarian patron view.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in with a patron with an email.
2. Go to the RERO ID update information form. Update the email.
3. Logout
4. Log in with a librarian, and check the email of the previous patron. The email did not changed.

**Expected behavior**
The user patron record should be in sync with the patron information profile.

milestone.title: v0.14.1
milestone.description: A clean release for pilot libraries.

body:
In the holdings editor, the patterns section. If a librarian enters an invalid `issue display template`, the backend returns error 400.

Once this error dedected by the holdings editor, you can no longer display the `pattern preview`.

Even if you correct the `template` problem in the editor. The only way out, is to save the holdings and then go back to the editor to see the correct preview. 

version 0.14.0

title: Removing existing user role can lead to unintended issues.

labels.name: effort: important
labels.description: US candidate

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

body:
**Describe the bug**
Removing an existing role of a user can lead to unintended issues.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the professional interface
2. Find a patron **that has subscription* and edit it.
3. Remove its patron role and add the librarian role.
4. Complete the form accordingly.
5. Try to save and see that the spinner never ends.

**Expected behavior**
The expected behavior is certainly that you cannot remove existing role without further controls: are subscriptions, fees, loans attached to this patron? Is this user the last existing system librarian of an organisation?

**Context**

* server: [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][1]
* version (US patron without email):
    * rero-ils version [2ad75f82][2]
    * rero-ils-ui version [a080c438][3]

[1]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/commit/2ad75f82a1cf64b4dbdd1c0ae42a0ad99518854d
[3]: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils-ui/commit/a080c438d8e7a7e5e4ee7ba83268fff27206c2fa

title: transactions: fix paid fees still opened

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.14.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.14.0 release, after the end of the 36th sprint

body:
The bit representation of real number
(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754) cause problem with arithmetic
operation on them (10-9.54 = 0.460000000000085). This commit fixes this
problem by multiplying transaction amount by 100 and cast them into
integer when arithmetic operations are done.

Closes rero/rero-ils#1373

Co-Authored-by: Renaud Michotte <renaud.michotte@gmail.com>


## Code review check list

- [ ] Commit message template compliance.
- [ ] Commit message without typos.
- [ ] File names.
- [ ] Functions names.
- [ ] Functions docstrings.
- [ ] Unnecessary commited files?

title: Identifier qualifier, status and note should be displayed in the document detailed view

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Improvement of an existing feature

labels.description: Professional interface

labels.description: Public interface, as opposed to the professional interface

labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.14.0

body:
**How it works**

Concerns the public and professional interface
* Identifier qualifier, status and note, for documents, are not displayed in the document detailed view.
* Only the first identifier is displayed.

**Improvement suggestion**
Concerns the public and professional interface:
* all identifiers are displayed
* qualifier, status and note are displayed after the value. Exemple: [value] - [qualifier], [status], [note] [badge with the type]
* ideally the `source` for identifiers of type `bf:Local` is displayed in the badge instead of the mention *bf:Local*.

**Context**
* server: ilspilot.test.rero.ch
* version: v0.12.0

Proposed by the pilot libraries

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/98269674-51048580-1f8e-11eb-9d40-e68b734ab67a.png)

body:
**Describe the bug**
The language displayed is inconsistent. Sometimes it is English even if French is selected. This was observed in the public view, with Chrome and Firefox.
It is possible that the same problem appears also in the professional view.

**To Reproduce**
Difficult to reproduce; it is not stable.

* In the public interface brief view
    1. Do a search, check the interface language
    2. Change the language, check if it worked
    3. Re-do a search (sometimes the language return to the first one)
    4. Etc.

**Expected behavior**
Language is determined by the browser and is stored for the next session. If I change language, it stores the new one.

**Context**

* server: ils.test.rero.ch, v0.12.0

**Screenshots**
In this picture, some parts of the interface are in Italian (correct), some others in English.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/98243871-d8420100-1f6e-11eb-8be4-8a240f9042b0.png)


**Additional context**
Proposed by pilot libraries

**Describe the bug**

In the pro and public patron account (ilspilot.test.rero.ch, v0.12.0, 05.11.20), loans are marked as overdue too late. See 1st screenshot.
Update: in v1.0.1 (ils.test.rero.ch, 04.03.21), the overdue badge is not displayed anymore. Effect, some overdue loans with no fees (or fees already paid) are not displayed distinctly. Ok in the public patron account. See 2nd screenshot.

All loans with a due date before the current date have an *overdue* badge, in the professional patron account.

First major RERO ILS release. Try to fix as many issues that is possible.

A project is created to see the progress of this peculiar milestone: https://github.com/orgs/rero/projects/6?fullscreen=true

body:
**Describe the bug**

I have an item in transit. It is requested by patron A. It is checked out for this patron *without reception at desk*. This situation leads to a problem:
1. either the request seems not to have been validated (if it was in transit to house). Consequence: it still appears in the requests.
1. or I have an red error message (see screenshot)

**To Reproduce**

Case 1
1. Take an item in transit to house
1. Add a request on it for patron A
1. Check out the item for patron A
1. See tab "Requests" of patron A
1. See item detailed view

Case 2
1. Take an item on loan by patron X
1. Add a request on it for patron A
1. Checkin the item so that it goes in transit for pickup
1. Check out the item for patron A
1. See error message

**Expected behavior**

At the checkout, the loan is automatically validated and received, so that it does not appear as a request anymore.

**Context**

* server: ils.test.rero.ch
* version: v0.13.0
* See [checkout form actions][1]

[1]: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/dev/doc/circulation/actions.md#checkout-form

Proposed by pilot libraries

**Screenshots**

Case 1: there are now 2 loans for the same patron:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/98139849-f4896380-1ec4-11eb-9ed7-6fc23fd741ca.png)

Case 2: error message
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/98140367-a759c180-1ec5-11eb-896c-8676c772542d.png)

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the circulation policy, section *Application*, the editor does not behave as expected. When unchecking the last item type for a patron type, the list of item types disappear.

**To Reproduce**
1. Log in as system librarian
1. Edit a circulation policy
1. Check a patron type > item types are displayed below

title: serial pattern preview type error

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

body:
When a librarian or a system librarian pulls the holdings editor and tries to edit or create a new holdings patterns, Sentry reports this problem:

``` 
TypeError api_holding.pattern_preview
strptime() argument 1 must be str, not None
```

So it seems that  the `next_expected_date` is not sent to the backend at some point:

```
rero_ils/modules/holdings/api.py in _increment_next_prediction at line 401
patterns.get('next_expected_date'), '%Y-%m-%d')
```
ref: https://sentrydev.test.rero.ch:8443/organizations/sentry/issues/8983/?query=is%3Aunresolved

This could be related to the Taiga task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/rero21-reroils/task/1820?kanban-status=1224893 (editor sends many calls to the backend)

title: A system librarian without role librarian doesn't have all rights and has bugs

labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

milestone.title: v0.14.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.14.0 release, after the end of the 36th sprint

body:
**How it works**

A system librarian without role librarian don't have "edit" buttons on the brief views (he should). When he edits a resource, it spins forever. When he try to do a check-out for a patron, it spins forever and never opens the check-out form.

**To reproduce**

1. Open ilspilot.test.rero.ch
1. Edit an existing user
1. Give him the system librarian rights (but not the librarian rights)
1. Log in as this user
1. Try to
   * Do a checkout
   * Edit a document or another resource
   * Etc.

**How it should works**

A system librarian without role librarian should have all librarian rights plus others.

**Context**

Version: ilspilot.test.rero.ch (v0.12.0)

title: Requests in the queue are not correctly ordered.

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.14.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.14.0 release, after the end of the 36th sprint

body:
**Describe the bug**
The requests order is not respected in the pro interface.
If we change the pickup location and refresh the page, requests are re-ordered by pickup location.
Same when we try to delete a request (also https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/1303).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12396034/96426260-4eb7d280-11fd-11eb-8b48-8f87445fb248.png)
Here in the example, Katie should be 2nd in the queue. (BC 10000001717)

The transaction is processed correctly following the queue. 
Ex: If I made the checkout for Simonetta (1st), Katie will be correctly displayed as the following requester in the checkout interface.
After this transaction, the requests displayed in the item detail view will be correct again.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  Log in as a librarian or system librarian.
2.  Add multiple requests to an item.
3.  Change the pickup location and refresh the page.
4. See the order.

**Expected behavior**
The order should be always the same, even after a modification of the pickup location.

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch]
* version: *0.12.0*. 
* browser: [Chrome, Firefox]

title: Cannot delete a request of an item with multiple requests.

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.14.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.14.0 release, after the end of the 36th sprint

body:
**Describe the bug**
As a librarian, I cannot cancel a request if an item has more than one request.
I get the popup 'Do you really want to delete this request?', say yes, it refreshes the page but the request is still in the queue.
Logged in as a system librarian, I can delete the requests (linked to the affiliation/switch??)

As a Patron, on my profile, I can click on the cancel button, I get the message 'The request for item xxx has been canceled." but the request stays on my profile.
I can cancel requests if I'm the only requester.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Login as a librarian
2. Go to the professional interface
3. Add 2 or more requests to an item.
4. Try to delete a request
5. Login as a user.
6. Check the request tab of the profile.
7. Try to cancel request with or without queue.

**Expected behavior**
A librarian should be able to cancel a request from the item detail view.

* server: [ils.test.rero.ch]
* version: *0.12.0*.

In the professional interface, the staff cannot delete an item with the status 'at desk'.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in as a librarian.
2. Go to the Requests section and scan a barcode.
3. Click on the Patron name.
4. Check the 'to pickup' tab of the patron and click on an item.
5. On the item detail view, the delete icon says 'item cannot be canceled'.

**Expected behavior**
A librarian should be able to delete a request of an item which is 'at desk'.

title: circulation: unable to display a patron account in public view when he has a dispute.

body:
**Describe the bug**
The issue occurs in the public view, when the patron is logged and he wants to access its profile.
If he has a "dispute" transaction in the history of fees, he gets an internal server error on the screen.

The server logs shows this kind of message:

> File "/invenio/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/rero-ils-Ta2-9VdS-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/jinja2/runtime.py", line 679, in _invoke
>     rv = self._func(*arguments)
>   File "/invenio/src/rero_ils/modules/patrons/templates/rero_ils/_macro_profile.html", line 123, in template
>     {{ event.amount | format_currency(event.currency) }}
>   File "./rero_ils/modules/patrons/views.py", line 238, in format_currency_filter
>     return format_currency(value, currency)
>   File "/invenio/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/rero-ils-Ta2-9VdS-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/flask_babelex/__init__.py", line 444, in format_currency
>     number, currency, format=format, locale=locale
>   File "/invenio/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/rero-ils-Ta2-9VdS-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/babel/numbers.py", line 521, in format_currency
>     decimal_quantization=decimal_quantization)
>   File "/invenio/.cache/pypoetry/virtualenvs/rero-ils-Ta2-9VdS-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/babel/numbers.py", line 943, in apply
>     **value = decimal.Decimal(str(value))
> decimal.InvalidOperation: [<class 'decimal.ConversionSyntax'>]**


**To Reproduce**

1. Go to ilsdev.test.rero.ch
2. login as Astrid and go to the professional interface.
3. Take the account of Simonetta, Tabs "Fees" and do a **dispute** for an open fee
4. Logout, then login as Simonetta
5. In the public view, try to access the patron profie. You should get an Internal Server Error.

**Expected behavior**
A patron with fees (and dispute) should be able to display its profile.

**Context**
Tell us on what server did you spotted the issue, using with browser.

* server: ilsdev.test.rero.ch
* version: 0.12

In the professional view, when you renew a loan from the patron account, it doesn't display the new due date.
You need to refresh the page or the Tab 'Checkout/Checkin', in order to see the new due date. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to ilsdev.test.rero.ch, login as reroilstest+jean@gmail.com
2. Go to Professional Interface and get the patron account of Broglio, Giulia 
3. In the checkout/checkin Tab, Renew an item and see the due date disappear.
   The due date is replaced by "a blank".

**Expected behavior**
When a librarian renew a loan, the new due date must be displayed directly on the screen, without the need to refresh the page.

title: When a new self registered user access to a document detailed view, an internal server error is raised

labels.name: f: public ui
labels.description: Public interface, as opposed to the professional interface

labels.name: f: permissions
labels.description: Concerns the rights management

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

body:
**Describe the bug**
In the public view, when a self registered user want access to document details view,
it raises an internal server error.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the registration form and create a new account, you will receive a validation email
2. validate your account by clicking link in the email
3. Log in with your new account on rero-ils
4. Do a search and click on a document
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The new logged in user can view the detail of a document.

**Context**
* server: all (local, ils.test.rero.ch, ilsdev.test.rero.ch, ...)
* version: v0.12.0

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38690496/95058811-5903a800-06f8-11eb-87ab-6e6f570353fc.png)

**Additional context**
When a user registers on the site, its new account is not associated with a Patron resource.
It's only an invenio user. 
In the document detail view, there is a method to check if the user can request the document.
To do that, we need the patron resource.

title: Holdings for journals have various problems

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes, the
* hidden issues cannot be expanded
* tab "Description" is empty
* issue reception is not possible (due to holdings import from Virtua with type "standard" instead of "serial")
* mousehover on the trash does not display any message (same reason than previous point)
* library is not always displayed in the holdings; there is an empty string before the location

**To Reproduce**
* Log in as a librarian in organisation Valais (ex: reroilspilot+vs1950s@gmail.com)
* Open https://ilspilot.test.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/detail/12664
* Try to display the hidden issues (impossible)
* Try to display the tab "Description" (impossible)
* Try to receive an issue for the first displayed holdings
* Try to mousehover the trash for the first displayed holdings
* See that the library is not always displayed in the holdings (before the location)

**Expected behavior**
* hidden issues can be expanded
* tab "Description" is displayed
* issue reception is possible for serial holdings; the button is not displayed for standard holdings
* mousehover on the trash always displays a message if the button is disabled
* the library is always displayed in the holdings, just before the location

**Context**
* server: ilspilot.test.rero.ch
* version: v0.12.0

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/94794507-42014500-03dc-11eb-9d93-a503d1e59a8b.png)

title: Unable to use dynamic date with a "+" character for the new acquisition URL creation

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: f: acquisitions
labels.description: Related to the acquisition module

labels.name: p-Medium
labels.description: Medium priority (to be solved within 1-2 years)

milestone.title: v1.0.0
milestone.description:
First major RERO ILS release. Try to fix as many issues that is possible.

A project is created to see the progress of this peculiar milestone: https://github.com/orgs/rero/projects/6?fullscreen=true

body:
**Describe the bug**

If you try to search about new acquisitions with dynamic url in the future, the "+" character is url_encoded and this cause an error 500.

**To Reproduce**
https://localhost:5000/global/search/documents?q=&page=1&size=10&new_acquisition=:now+1w

**Expected behavior**
Argument value should be decoded to allow search on date in the future
See this function : https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/blob/dev/rero_ils/query.py#L50 
Add url_decode param after this line : ```values = dict(zip(['from', 'to'], values.pop().split(':')))```

title: Selector with possible multiple value are not alphabetically sorted

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
**Describe the bug**

In the editor, selector values are alphabetically sorted using the translated strings. But if the selector allows selecting multiple value, the sorting does not apply. This is the case for the role of an agent contribution in the document editor.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to ils.test.rero.ch.
2. Log in as a librarian.
3. Create a new document (load the document editor).
4. Display the contribution field and check the content of the role selector in different languages. See that the values are not alphabetically sorted.

**Expected behavior**

All selector list values should be alphabetically sorted, no matter the type of the selector.

**Context**


* server: [ils.test.rero.ch][1], [ilsdev.test.rero.ch][2], [ilspilotdev.test.rero.ch][3].
* version: `v0.12.0rc`

**Screenshots**

![editor-agent-role-unsorted](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1557213/93465304-1fe6cd80-f8da-11ea-8fcf-9359ff9122c5.png)

**Additional context**

The code responsible for the sorting is on `ng-core`: https://github.com/rero/ng-core/blob/dev/projects/rero/ng-core/src/lib/record/editor/type/select-with-sort-type.component.ts

[1]: https://ils.test.rero.ch
[2]: https://ilsdev.test.rero.ch
[3]: https://ilspilotdev.test.rero.ch

title: The transaction history should base on the operation logs and not on the loans

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: f: professional ui
labels.description: Professional interface

labels.name: f: public ui
labels.description: Public interface, as opposed to the professional interface

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-High
labels.description: High priority (to be solved in the 2-3 next months)

body:
**How it works**

In the history tab of the patron profile (public interface) and in the patron account of the professional interface, the loan transaction history has errors:

1. display of the date at which the item should have been returned, not the actual checkin date. This is the case in the checkin column and in the transaction history itself (see screenshot below).
![patron-history-wrong-checkin-date](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1557213/93432723-72fa5980-f8b5-11ea-8d4c-998bc375bfe6.png)

2. sometimes no display of a line (because the item was deleted, or for other reasons)
Example in production: patron.pid:27115 (vs)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/133395086-9b0cb37b-34a2-4a8c-a4aa-4a36ba13acd0.png)

**How it should works**

All data are recovered from the operation logs:
1. The checkin date displayed should be the actual checkin date (in my example, it was the 2020-09-17, not the 2020-10-15).
The checkin date is displayed for each fee in the fee tab.
2. Loans on deleted items are still displayed

**Related issue**

- Request date shouldn't be updated after validation https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/issues/1704

body:
**Describe the bug**

On the professional interface, when displaying the detailed view of a journal with lots of issues, a *show more…* link is collapsed by default and the number of hidden issues is displayed. The string is provided by the following function:

https://github.com/rero/rero-ils-ui/blob/dev/projects/admin/src/app/record/detail-view/document-detail-view/holding/holding.component.ts#L165

The result is some combinations of "hidden", "issue" and "issues", which, once translated, can be rendered as "29 caché fascicules".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to ils.test.rero.ch, version `v0.12.0rc`.
2. Log as a librarian (Astrid).
3. Search for "Conférence : [revue semestrielle]" in the professional interface.
4. Display its detailed view.
1. See the string "(4 caché issues)".

**Expected behavior**

We should have either the string "hidden issue" or "hidden issues" to translate.

**Context**

title: The BnF import is wrong for provision activity.

labels.name: f: data
labels.description: About data model, importation, transformation, exportation of data, specific for bibliographic data

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
**Describe the bug**
* The provision activity is imported twice from BnF.
* The country codes are wrong.

**To Reproduce**
1. Open https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/documents/new?source=bnf&pid=FRBNF455643090000009
1. There is two provision activites instead of one, and the country code should be Switzerland instead of China.

**Expected behavior**
* Import [field 214](https://www.transition-bibliographique.fr/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/B214-2019.pdf) only (ind2 indicated the `provisionActivity.type`
  * If not 214, import [field 210](https://www.transition-bibliographique.fr/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/B210-6-2012.pdf). 
    * $a$b$c is for bf:Publication
    * $e$g$h is for bf:Manufacture
* Import country codes from field 102$a and map them to our codes
  * Mapping table MARC21/UNIMARC of the country code is available in the following internal file, columns H-I: `documentation\projets\RERO21\metadata\document\listes_controlees\noms_de_pays\conversion_codes_pays_marc21_unimarc.xlsx`
* Import bf:Publication startDate and endDate from [field 100](https://www.transition-bibliographique.fr/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/B100-6-2010.pdf), pos. 9-12 (startDate) and pos. 13-16 (endDate)

**Context**
* server: ils.test.rero.ch
* version: 0.12.0rc

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8154915/93202170-922ca600-f752-11ea-92a9-183542fce764.png)

body:
**Describe the bug**
When an item of library A, in transit to library C, is checked-in in library B, there are no information to show the status and the destination of the item.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an item in library A
2. Make a request for a patron to be picked-up in library C
3. Checkin the item in library A. The item is in transit to library C.
4. Checkin the item in library B. There is no information displayed about the transit.

**Expected behavior**
A line is displayed with the mention that no action has been realised, the item status and the pickup library.

**Context**
dev of rero-ils: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils/commit/c12a4dff3f8b460e8a695e7e70e8ee635f5f36d8
dev of rero-ils-ui: https://github.com/rero/rero-ils-ui/commit/78cc6e5742b9ffdfbddf27d33f0d77710f9885c4
ng-core v0.8.0

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: celery scheduler can not locate the method task_clear_and_renew_subscriptions

labels.name: f: circulation
labels.description: Concerns the circulation interface or backend

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.12.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.12.0 release, after the end of the 33th sprint.

body:
In a deployed environment, celery scheduler is unable to locate  the method `task_clear_and_renew_subscriptions`  which is used to clear patron subscriptions. 

This is due to the fact that `task_clear_and_renew_subscriptions` is configured in `config.py` and its path not present in `setup.py` 

Getting the following error message:

`KeyError celery.worker.consumer.consumer in on_task_received
rero_ils.modules.patrons.tasks.task_clear_and_renew_subscriptions
`
on the ilsdev instance.

title: Switching library to place a request for a patron, result in a none displayed requests

labels.name: f: consortial
labels.description: Related to the consortial structure or functionalities

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

body:
**Describe the bug**
Logged as a system librarian, I switch library to place a request on an item for a patron, and I got the confirmation that the request has been recorded and I can see it in the requests management interface of my library. However, when I try to edit the queue, the queue is empty.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Log in as Astrid.
2. Find an item that is not in Astrid default library. For me the title "La reine Blabla" has an item in the Bibliothèque communale et scolaire d'Avise. At this point, I don't have the possibility to place a request (see #927).
3. With the switch library button, select the Bibliothèque communale et scolaire d'Avise.
4. On the document detailed view, use the basket icon button of the item to place a request for `kad001` (Katie).
1. See that the request is recorded.
1. Find that request in the requests management interface.
1. Try to edit the requests queue of this item, and see that the request you just created is not displayed.
1. Log out and log in with another librarian (Elena for Avise) and verify you can see the created request.

**Expected behavior**
I should see the request created.

**Context**

* server
   - ils.test.rero.ch, v0.11.0
   - ilsdev.test.rero.ch
       - rero-ils version ce71d4bd
       - rero-ils-ui version 9135687f

**Additional context**
At least once, on ils.dev, after switching library, the switch library button disappeared. I don't know if it's related.

title: Authors and issuance fields: organisation as author and subtype are not loaded correctly when editing a record with those fields

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

milestone.title: v0.11.0
milestone.description: Probable date for the v0.11.0 release, after the 32th sprint.

body:
**Describe the bug**
When editing a record, the mode of issuance is not loaded correctly and we lose data. It's the same behaviour for an organisation as author. This is related to the `oneOf` property in jsonschema and the way it's used in ngx-formly.

An issue has been reported on ngx-formly: https://github.com/ngx-formly/ngx-formly/issues/2374

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a record that has an organisation as author
2. Edit the record
3. The author is a person and the name of the organisation is lost
4. Similar behaviour is noted for 'mode of issuance' field with value different than default one

**Expected behavior**
The right data should be kept and displayed in the form.

title: Typing char or string in integer type field is possible on Firefox, no validation message

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Stale or no longer relevant

body:
**Describe the bug**
It is possible to type char, for example 'a', 'b' or 'c', or even string, in integer-type fields when using the editor in Firefox. There is no validation error message to warn the user.
Example: `provisionActivity.startDate` - when adding a letter, the field validation message is "This field is required" ; when adding an integer with only one character (instead of 4), there is no field validation message but a global error on the form "The form contains errors.".
Example: `partOf` - year and pages have a validation (impossible to save a string not integer), but not numbering and volume (we can save a string not integer without error message, but they are not saved).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the document editor
2. Display 'part of' field
3. Type something in volume or issue field
4. The record can't be saved. There is no validation message to warn about the wrong type of data.

**Expected behavior**
It shouldn't be possible to type anything else than an integer in those fields.

**Context**
This is related to the behaviour of ngx-formly. Therefore, an issue was reported on the repo: https://github.com/ngx-formly/ngx-formly/issues/2360

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

title: State of button on/off in circulation policy editor

labels.name: f: circulation

labels.name: f: editor
labels.description: Concerns editor based on JSON schema AND custom editor

labels.name: bug

body:
**Describe the issue**
In the circulation policy editor, the button on/off to enable the renewals does not behave as expected. It is always in the state (on or off) we let it in the last edition, even if we didn't save the form. It is not linked to the effective data of the policy.

**To Reproduce**
1. Edit a circulation policy with renewals enabled (ex. [Short adults](https://ils.test.rero.ch/professional/records/circ_policies/edit/5))
1. Don't modify anything but deactivate the button on/off of the renewals
1. Leave the page without saving
1. Edit again the same policy, ***or any other policy with renewals enabled***
1. The button is deactivated, but renewals are still enabled by this policy ([check API!](https://ils.test.rero.ch/api/circ_policies/5))
1. Activate the button and you will see what are the effective data of this policy

**Expected behavior**
The button always display the effective data of the policy. Check also the other buttons on/off!

**Software version**
ils.test.rero.ch (version 0.6.1)
ilspilot (phase 1 of tests)

title: Unused RERO_ILS environment variables

labels.name: developers
labels.description: From a developer point of view.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Breaks something but is not blocking

labels.name: p-Low
labels.description: Low priority

body:
### Description

Some environment variables are unused in the application. In example: RERO_ILS_MEF_RESULT_SIZE is set, but unused.

### How I check this

To check how many times are used each variables that start with "RERO_ILS", I do:

```bash
for i in `grep -E '^RERO_ILS' rero_ils/config.py|cut -d= -f1`; do echo -n "$i: "; grep -r "$i" . -l --exclude="config.py" --exclude-dir=".git"|wc -l; done
```
I then saw that these variables are unused:

```ini
RERO_ILS_EDITOR_TEMPLATE
RERO_ILS_PERMALINK_RERO_URL
RERO_ILS_PERMALINK_BNF_URL
RERO_ILS_MEF_RESULT_SIZE
```

### Optional

It would be interessant to document each RERO_ILS variable. We found a documentation in **docs/_build/html/configuration.html** after the `pipenv run build_sphinx` command.
